When you add water to juice it is no longer considered a juice but a soft drink... I wrote to capri sun and they sent me like a 1 page long exolanation as to why they legaly can't call capri sun a juice.

As an Italian citizen I am struggling to believe these scams even exist. I'm not saying that Italian food is immune from misleading packages or chips bags full of gas, but man I'm glad we have strict quality control laws here!
My mother works in food defense and always told me that an error like "100% juice / 27% juice" could potentially cost a lot of money to the company, not to mention that all the goods with that packaging must be destroyed.

I did haha but I also grrrd so much.
(P.S.: "Raviolo" is the singular of "Ravioli", like, "here's a sad raviolo swimming in a sea of emotionless sugo (tomato sauce)")
(P.P.S.: I know it sounds a little bad as a term but "Food Defense" is the name of the department. She and her colleagues are responsible of Analysis and Tracking for incoming and outgoing goods and they make sure everyone follows HACCP and other safety protocols.)

Fun fact:

Actually ravioli is the plural term
The correct term for a single one is raviolo

I remember watching a Futurama episode where in the future, companies are able to influence dreams and make them into advertisements.  And while I was watching I was laughing, but I also came to to realization that if companies could change your dreams into advertisements to sell their products, they would.

I've been genuinely wondering this a lot too lately. advertisements are literally plastered everywhere in our world; online, in real life and probably even in our homes in subtle ways. it's so crazy how much this stuff is shoved down our throats and how we probably won't be able to escape adverts no matter in the world we may end up. crazy
We need a law that makes canceling a subscription as easy as subscribing to things like newsletter sites and stuff on the internet.

I have a bookmarks tab, that I label, if programming were that easy, and if I see those clickbaity images in news sites and what not, I find ones that seem to be a gem, and I save them in my “if programming were that easy” tab.

That Proactiv one is not what people think it is. The reason the box is that big while the contents are that small is because the boxes are standardized. It would cost the company more money to set up an entire production line for a new type of box, when they could just use the same boxes they're already making. And that's what they choose to do. There's nothing malicious about it, they probably state the fluid content on the box anyway.
I'm so glad Pewds is covering these topics. We need our voices heard! mukbangs are obnoxious, the dislike button shouldnt have been removed, and webpages are a lawless wasteland

PSA: Whenever you see a popup from a request asking to send you notifications, DONT INTERACT WITH IT!!! even if you say Block, they can still run scripts that can redirect you to malicious websites.

Instead, go into your browser setting and enable the "Block notification requests" option. It depends on your browser but most have that option

Stay safe, fam

The Cardboard Box with the smaller pocket is so the Same Box can be used for different products. The size of the Pocket might differ, but the Box (and the needed parts on the Machine) stay the same -> way better for smaller lots and logistics (one size instead of 10 different sizes)

As someone who has connections in the industry through an organic farm who had to go through the process in Canada of becoming organic, and spoke with many people about marketing etc etc, the juice used is 100% juice. The product itself is not made entirely of juice, but instead made using 100% juice.

Here's how it works:
If you use juice concentrate as an ingredient, if it's the equivalent of 100% once reconstituted, you can claim it "100% juice"
Fun fact: you can trademark “slogans” such as ‘100% fruit’ so you can advertise this on your product without breaking the law even when it’s not true
